meanings.sent1: The cat is fatter than the dog.
meanings.sent2: She prefers fatter pillows for extra comfort.
meanings.sent3: The fatter snowman melted faster in the sun.
meanings.sent4: The fatter clouds blocked out the sun completely.
meanings.sent5: The fatter book had more pages to read.

meanings.definition: To become larger in size or wider in girth.
meanings.sent1: He exercises to avoid getting fatter.
meanings.sent2: The cake will fatter if you add more frosting.
meanings.sent3: The balloon started to fatter after being inflated.
meanings.sent4: His wallet seemed to fatter with each paycheck.
meanings.sent5: The river tends to fatter after heavy rains.

meanings.definition: Having more flesh or adipose tissue.
meanings.sent1: The fatter squirrel stored more nuts for winter.
meanings.sent2: She felt fatter after indulging in holiday treats.
meanings.sent3: The fatter bear struggled to fit into its den.
meanings.sent4: The fatter baby giggled as it wobbled around.
meanings.sent5: The fatter caterpillar transformed into a beautiful butterfly.
